meanings.definition: Of or relating to populations of the same or closely related species that are geographically isolated from one another.
meanings.sent1: The allopatric birds in the forest had distinct colors due to their isolation.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the allopatric species to understand their unique adaptations.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that the allopatric monkeys were like distant cousins who never visited.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, the allopatric styles clashed like mismatched puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The children's book vividly illustrated the concept of allopatric animals living worlds apart.
